priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Coronary Artery Disease Presentation Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101843

self.title: CDISC SDTM Coronary Artery Disease Presentation Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist associated with coronary artery disease presentation.
name: Coronary Artery Disease Presentation
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Coronary Artery Disease Presentation Terminology

terms.definition: A myocardial infarction that does not produce elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.
terms.preferredTerm: Non-ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding

terms.definition: A myocardial infarction that produces elevation in the ST segments of the ECG.
terms.preferredTerm: ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding

terms.definition: Angina pectoris which has not recently changed in frequency, duration or intensity. Stable angina pectoris is relieved by rest or administration of oral, sublingual or transdermal antianginal medications.
Angina pectoris (or equivalent type of ischemic discomfort) which has recently changed in frequency, duration, intensity, or occurs at rest.
A variant form of angina pectoris caused by coronary artery vasospasm, usually occurring spontaneously and frequently associated with ST segment elevation.
